content: after you ve completed it to keep track of where you are round 1 *knit 10 knit two together * repeat until the end of the round you ll be left with 77 total stitches you should finish the round on a k2tog round 2 knit one round round 3 *k9 k2tog* repeat until the end of the round 70 stitches left round 4 repeat round 2 this will be repeated for every even-numbered round round 5 *k8 k2tog* repeat until the end of the round 63 stitches left round 7 *knit 7 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 56 stitches left round 9 *k6 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 49 stitches left round 11 *k5 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 42 stitches left ⓒ 2022 maggie billings maggiebillingsknits@gmail com round 13 *k4 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 35 stitches left round 15 *k3 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 28 stitches left round 17 *k2 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 21 stitches left round 19 *k1 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round you should now have 14 stitches total round 20 k2tog all the way around leaving 7 stitches cut the yarn leaving a 10 tail to finish with thread the end of the tail through a tapestry needle while keeping the stitches on the needles thread the tail through all 7 stitches twice take the needles out and pull the tail tightly to close the top of the hat weave the tail into the inside of the hat to keep it from unraveling use a technique that doesn t show through to the front of the hat weave the cast-on tail into the inside of the brim of the hat so that it does not unravel leave any extra tail left after weaving in attached to the hat until after blocking blocking blocking is the process of wetting a finished project and letting it dry in its final shape this helps all the fibers in the yarn settle into the stitches and makes everything look neat and smooth blocking also gives you an opportunity to wash off any crumbs grease pet hair or other gunk that got on the hat while you were knitting it it takes a little extra time but your work deserves a good finish materials ● wool wash or dish soap ● bowl big enough to submerge the hat ● towel ● a flat surface that won t be damaged by something wet sitting on it for a few hours directions 1 put a small amount of specialty wool wash or dish soap in a bowl of cold water large enough to fully immerse the hat do not use regular laundry soap most laundry soaps have enzymes that will break down the proteins in wool and degrade it 2 submerge the hat try not to agitate it too much so that it doesn t felt 3
